rules.starting-tiles-different-configuration: Some expansions provides alternative starting configurations.
rules.farmers-description: Players are allowed to place meeples on fields.
rules.garden-description: Can be occupied by an abbot.
rules.cathedral-description: Completed cities with cathedral ×3 instead of ×2, no points during final scoring.
rules.cathedral-disabled: No tile with Cathedral is in game.
rules.inn-description: Completed roads with inn ×2, no points during final scoring.
rules.inn-disabled: No tile with Inn is in the game.
rules.princess-description: Princess can remove knight from a city.
rules.princess-disabled: No tile with Princess is in game.
rules.portal-description: Through magic portal meeple can be placed on any tile.
rules.portal-disabled: No tile with Magic portal Princess is in game.
rules.bazaar-description: Land tiles are auctioned when bazaar comes into play.
rules.bazaar-disabled: No tile with Bazaar is in game.
rules.hill-description: Used as tiebreaker. Also hides one random tile under it.
rules.hill-disabled: No tile with Hill is in game.
rules.vineyard-disabled: No tile with Vineyard is in game.
rules.pig-herd-description: Counts as additional pig on field (farmers scores more points).
rules.pig-herd-disabled: No tile with Pig herd is in game.
rules.shrine-description: Shrine placed next to a monastery compete who finish feature first. (second gets no points)
rules.shrine-disabled: No tile with Shrine is in game.
rules.festival-description: With festival tile you can return one of your own figures instead of placing one.
rules.festival-disabled: No tile with Festival is in game.
rules.siege-disabled: No tile with Siege is in game.
rules.escape-description: Escape allowed via a neighboring monastery.
rules.escape-disabled: No tile with Siege is in game.
rules.acrobats-description: Placing meeple as an acrobat on acrobat space.
rules.acrobats-disabled: No tile with Acrobats space is in game.

princess-action.description: The Princess {} remove knight from a city.

barn-placement.description: Barn {} be placed on a field already occupied by another barn.

wagon-move.description: After scored, wagon can me moved to adjacent unoccupied, incomplete feature. Adjacent means: {}
wagon-move.C1: connected (road crossing or road heading to a city/monastery) (1st ed.)
wagon-move.C2: feature on the same or an adjacent tile (2nd ed.)

bazaar-no-auction.description: No bazaar bidding. Each player just chooses one tile.

espace-variant.description: Monastery must be placed adjacent to {} of a besieged city to escape.

gq11-pig-herd.description: Field tile from Game Quarterly 11 expansion {}.

tunnelize-other-expansions.description: Apply tunnel rule on tiles from other expansions with depicted tunnels.

more-tunnel-tokens.description: Assign {} token sets to each player in game of two/three.

festival-return.description: Player may return one of one’s own {}.

coc-final-scoring.description: Moving meeples from the City of Carcassonne before final scoring {}.
coc-final-scoring.market-only: is allowed only from market district (C2)

count-move.description: When meeple is deployed to the City of C. then the Count is moved {}.
count-move.follow-meeple: to whichever district as the meeple

king-and-robber-scoring.default: 1 point for every completed feature at the end of the game
king-and-robber-scoring.10/20: 10 points / each card at the end of the game
king-and-robber-scoring.15/40: 15/40 pts for having single/both cards at the end of the game

timer.at-game-start-set-timer-to: At game start set timer to

open-game.share-the-key: Share the key with other players to let them connect to the game.
open-game.waiting-for-host-to-start-the-game: Waiting for host to start the game.
open-game.name: Name

online.title: Public server hosted games
online.private-games-only: Only private games are now supported.
online.no-random-discovery: it means no random players discovery
online.remove-unfinished-game-confirmation: Do you want to permanently remove unfinished game from your list?
online.paste-a-game-key: Paste a game key provided by host
online.you-have-no-game-in-progress: You have no game in progress.
online.online-storage-description: Leaving online game just keep the unfinished game in the background. You can rejoin it from this list whenever you want.

local.title: Player hosted games
local.create-directly-from: Create a new game directly from

index.automatic-updates-linux-only: Automatic updates are currently supported only on Linux platform. Please download new version directly and update manually.

bookmarks.title: My favorities
bookmarks.description-start: You have not game setup in favorites list. To add setup here create a game first and then use

join-game.title: Join Remote Game
join-game.description:
Connect to remote host with created game.
The game on remote host must be in color selection phase.

player.title: Player
player.nickname-description: Nickname used when player is assigned to a game.
player.preferred-color-description: Automatically take a color after game join.

game-interface.title: Game Interface
game-interface.turn-confirmation-description: Confirmation allows player undo performed actions before activity is passed to a next player. It happens before scoring or eg. in during opponent turn when you move wagon, etc. Enable explicit confirmation…
game-interface.only-when-meeple-was-deployed-on-a-field: only when meeple was deployed on a field
game-interface.only-when-meeple-was-deployed-on-a-tower: only when meeple was deployed on a tower
game-interface.beep-description: Beep when you are on turn (or when your action is required during opponent's turn).
game-interface.player-list-description: You may enable player list (right sidebar) rotation.
game-interface.player-list-active-on-top: Keep active player always on top
game-interface.player-list-local-on-top: Keep local player always on top

appearance.title: Appearance
appearance.artworks-description: Additional artworks may by provided by add-ons.

add-ons.title: Add-ons
add-ons.installation-is-not-avoled-during-game: Installing or removing add-on is not allowed when game is running or game setup is open.
add-ons.finish-or-leave-game-to-make-changes: Please finish or leave the game first to make changes here.
add-ons.drag-add-on-here-or-click-here: Drag add-on here (.jca file) or click here to select it.
add-ons.artwork-not-found-internet-connection-is: Unable to locate or download addon with default artwork. Internet conection is needed at fist run to donwload it.
add-ons.please-check-connectivity-and-restart-ap: Please check your connectivity and restart app to try it again.

java.title: Java
java.description: Although JCloisterZone client is pure native application, Java is required to run game engine. In other words to play a game.
java.you-may-set-path: You can set manually path to {0}
java.warning-file-is-not-java-binary: File doesn't look like a Java binary.
java.unable-to-find-java: Unable to locate Java on your system.
java.java-is-required: Java is required to start a game.
java.java-path-is-not-valid: Your manually configured Java path is not valid.
java.java-version-found: Java 11 or higher is required (found {version}) to start a game.
java.verify: If Java is already installed, verify if Java is added to your system path or select java binary manually in {settings}.
java.select-manually: Or select proper java manually in {settings}.

engine.engine-path-not-exists: Can't locate game engine (file {path} doesn't exist or can't be read)
engine.unable-to-spawn-game-engine: Unable to spawn game engine. Details:

tile-set.abbey-and-mayor-release: The fifth major expansion released in 2007.
tile-set.abbey-and-mayor-description: Each a player can also place Abbey tile from his supply.
tile-set.base-game-description: You can play tiles with 1st Edition or New edition rules (eg. gardens). This can be selected in second game setup step.
tile-set.bridges-castles-and-bazaars-release: The eight major expansion released in 2010. (Sixth major expansion Count, King and Robber is splitted into individual small modules. Seventh, The Catapult, is obvously skipped)
tile-set.gq11-release: Originally released in Games Quarterly magazine in 2006.
tile-set.hills-and-sheep-release: The ninth major expansion released in 2014.
tile-set.inns-and-cathedrals-release: First major expansion for Carcassonne released in 2002.
tile-set.king-and-robber-release: Originally released in 2003 as part of King & Scout. Later included in the sixth major expansion: Count, King & Robber (2007)
tile-set.princess-and-dragon-release: The third major expansion released in 2005.
tile-set.river-I-release: The River I is mini expansion released in 2001.
tile-set.river-II-release: The River II was released in 2006 and now is contained in sixth major expansion Count, King & Robber.
tile-set.tower-release: The fourth major expansion released in 2006.
tile-set.traders-and-builders-release: The second major expansion released in 2003
tile-set.winter-edition-description: Basic set from Winter Edition spin-off. Contains basic game extended with additional 12 tiles.

tile-pack-dialog.disabled-show-remaining: The game was created with option which doesn't allow showing remaining tiles count.
tile-pack-dialog.hidden-tiles-under-hill: Don't forget that {count} unknown {tiles} from list is hidden under a hill.

action.you-may-place-a-meeple-in-a-city-distric: You may place a meeple in a city district.
action.player-may-place-a-meeple-in-a-city-dist: Player may place a meeple in a city district.
action.you-may-move-a-meeple-from-a-city-distri: You may move a meeple from a city district.
action.player-may-move-a-meeple-from-a-city-dis: Player may move a meeple from a city district.
action.you-may-move-a-meeple-from-the-market-di: You may move a meeple from the market district before final scoring.
action.player-may-move-a-meeple-from-the-market: Player may move a meeple from the market district before final scoring.
action.you-may-move-a-meeple-from-a-city-distri: You may move a meeple from a city district before final scoring.
action.player-may-move-a-meeple-from-a-city-dis: Player may move a meeple from a city district before final scoring.
action.you-may-place-a-meeple-next-to-already-p: You may place a meeple next to already present one.
action.player-may-place-a-meeple-next-to-alread: Player may place a meeple next to already present one.
action.bazaar-choose-a-tile-and-your-bid: Choose a tile and your bid
action.bazaar-player-must-choose-a-tile-and-bid: Player must choose a tile and bid
action.bazaar-player-must-raise-bid-or-pass: Player must raise bid or pass
action.bazaar-player-must-buy-sell-the-tile-fro: Player must buy/sell the tile from/to
action.crop-circles-player-must-choose: Player must choose: Each player may deploy or must remove meeple on/from {feature}.
action.crop-circles-choose-one: Choose one. Each player {deploy} or {remove} meeple on/from {feature}.
action.crop-circles-you-must-return-meeple: You must return on of your meeple.
action.siege-you-can-escape-a-besieged-city: You can escape a besieged city.
action.siege-player-can-escape-a-besieged-city: Player can escape a besieged city.
action.goldmines-player-must-place-a-gold-ingot: Player must place a gold ingot
action.mage-and-witch-player-must-remove-mage-o: Player must remove mage or witch.
action.tower-player-must-select-follower-for-ex: Player must select meeple for exchange
action.hills-and-sheep-tokens-left-plural: None tokens left | 1 token left | {tokens} tokens left
action.hills-and-receive-points-plural: receive 0 points | receive 1 point | receive {points} points
action.hills-and-player-must-choose-grow-or-sco: Player must choose to grow the flock or score sheep for {points} point. | Player must choose to grow the flock or score sheep for {points} points.
action.monasteries-how-do-you-want-place-follow: How do you want to place meeple on special monastery?
